subject: Basketball
Draft and Recruitment (Sports)
lead_paragraph: The Knicks signed their first-round draft pick, Wilson Chandler, left, the No. 23 overall selection. The 6-foot-8 Chandler played two seasons at DePaul, averaging 12.9 points and 7.1 rebounds. He started all five games for the Knicks’ team in the Las Vegas summer league, averaging 13.4 points a game and shooting 51 percent from the field. Chandler will make a little less than $1 million in each of his first two seasons. The Knicks hold one-year options for his third and fourth years.
